abstract: The Securities and Exchange Commission plans to vote on Wednesday whether to seek public comment on the accuracy of proxy voting in the United States.
snippet: The Securities and Exchange Commission plans to vote on Wednesday whether to seek public comment on the accuracy of proxy voting in the United States.
lead_paragraph: 5:39 p.m. | Updated The Securities and Exchange Commission voted unanimously to seek public comment on the proxy system, The New York Times’s Edward Wyatt reports, providing more details of the agency’s meeting.

headline.main: S.E.C. Examines Integrity of Proxy Voting
